channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Syrian opposition groups uniting to topple al-Assad
item.description: The development comes as world leaders remain deadlocked on what to do about the crackdown by the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Syria exposes U.S.-Russia rifts
item.description: U.S.-Russian sniping over Syria's growing conflict isn't the early frost of a new Cold War, but it highlights the chilly spots that remain between the onetime foes, longtime observers say.

item.title: 14 best airport amenities for layovers
item.description: It's inevitable these days. If you fly, you're going to have to spend a good amount of time at the airport, either waiting to take off or between flights. Thankfully, more and more airports are sympathetic to your situation and are adding unique amenities to help keep you entertained.

item.title: Expert: Sandusky should take stand
item.description: The defense will call witnesses for a second day in the Jerry Sandusky child sexual abuse trial Tuesday but it was still unclear if the former Penn State assistant coach will take the stand.

item.title: New Sandusky tape may shock trial
item.description: Prosecutors may introduce an unaired portion of Jerry Sandusky's interview with NBC's Bob Costas as evidence.

item.title: Colo. firefighters face more wind, heat
item.description: Forecasters are expecting warmer than normal temperatures and gusty winds Tuesday in a northern Colorado area ravaged by a wildfire, not a good combination for the 1,700 people battling the blaze

item.title: Facebook to tie ads to your Web use
item.description: Facebook will soon be using your Web browsing to help decide which advertisements you see.

item.title: Rescuing child sex slaves in Minn.
item.description: Minnesota kicks off a new initiative to rescue child sex slaves. CNN's Deborah Feyerick reports.

item.title: Roger Clemens acquitted on all charges
item.description: Baseball's Roger Clemens was found not guilty Monday of lying to Congress during an investigation of steroid use among major league players. "I put a lot of hard work into that career," he told reporters, choking up on the steps of the federal courthouse in Washington.

item.title: Opinion: Going after Clemens stupid
item.description: Well, Roger Clemens has finally done it.

item.title: Police: Man chops off daughter's head
item.description: Police in the northern India state of Rajasthan say they were stunned when a man showed up at a police outpost holding a bloody human head in one hand and a sword in another.

item.title: Popular Pakistani singer shot dead
item.description: A popular female Pakistani singer who defied the Taliban's decree against singing and dancing was shot and killed in northwest Pakistan Monday night, police and hospital officials told CNN.

item.title: U.S. deserter surfaces 28 years later
item.description: 28 years after going AWOL, fugitive David Hemler re-appears. His family thought he was dead. CNN's Mary Snow reports.

item.title: USAF mum on mystery space plane
item.description: Filmed with infrared cameras, a highly secretive unmanned Air Force space plane lands after more than a year in orbit.

item.title: Tiny Darth Vader leaves hospital
item.description: Max Page, the 7-year-old who played a mini-Darth Vader in a Volkswagen commercial, Monday left a hospital in Los Angeles where he had undergone heart surgery.

item.title: Drunk driver finds arresting cop
item.description: Affiliate KETV reports on an emotional reunion between a former drunk driver and the officer who arrested him.

item.title: Michelle Obama does double dutch
item.description: First lady Michelle Obama shows off her "double dutch" jump rope skills.

item.title: Rare white (but muddy) rhino born
item.description: Take a look at this rare baby rhinoceros born in Israel.

item.title: Watch giant mushroom storm cloud
item.description: A storm chaser captures the beauty of severe weather in western Minnesota on video.

item.title: Dad's best advice
item.description: People in downtown Atlanta step up to CNN's "Open Mic" to share dad's best advice and say happy Father's Day.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Waiting for our son to wake up
item.description: A freak accident during a trip to the beach left Ryan Buchanan in a persistent vegetative state. His parents are caring for him at home -- hoping that one day they'll be able to communicate with him again.

item.title: River rafting tour passes nude beach
item.description: A new river rafting tour takes travelers past a secluded beach often used by nude sunbathers. KOVR reports.

item.title: Famous fathers and their famous kids
The Taliban's unlikeliest foe
item.description: The Taliban has tried to kill Fawzia Koofi numerous times, once riddling her car with bullets. But that doesn't deter the two-term Parliamentary member from running to be Afghanistan's next president. And when the pressure seems unbearable, she turns toward her inspiration, her young daughters.

item.title: Koofi: 'Afghanistan has come a long way'
item.description: Fawzia Koofi, Afghanistan's first female Parliament speaker, discusses her plan to run for president of the country.

item.title: 'Sandusky 8' tell of seduction and betrayal
item.description: Eight young men who said they were molested by Jerry Sandusky told unforgettable stories about a man who called himself "The Great Pretender."

item.title: Photos: Our favorite TV dads
Open Mic: Dad's best advice
item.description: People in downtown Atlanta step up to CNN's "Open Mic" to share dad's best advice and say happy Father's Day.

item.title: Opinion: When a son surpasses his father
item.description: My heart was pounding so hard, it felt as if it were trying to break free from my body.

item.title: The bittersweet side of Father's Day
item.description: Kimberly Brewer's most memorable Father's Day was the one when she realized how much she would miss him.

item.title: Get a Father's Day check up
item.description: I am extremely blessed.

item.title: New owners, new story
item.description: For the Dodgers, a year makes all the difference.

item.title: Sex abuse covered up in Jewish sect?
item.description: CNN's Gary Tuchman reports on accusations of abuse in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community.

item.title: Teen can't recall how spear got in his head
item.description: Doctors say a teen who had a 3-foot spear shot through his skull is recovering. WSVN reports.

item.title: Is 'psychic' tech scary?
item.description: The future will emerge at Internet meet Le Web, says Andrew Keen, and it will change our lives.

item.title: Golden Retriever rides in side-car
item.description: Jim Larson and his Golden Retriever ride around in a Russian motorcycle with a side-car.

item.title: 'Jungle Bird' explains U.S. Open stunt
item.description: The man behind the "Jungle Bird" call during the U.S. Open ceremony sits down with Jeanne Moos to explain why he did it.

item.title: Musician embraces whistling on stage
item.description: Multi-instrumentalist Andrew Bird discusses his musical approach and the similarities between the violin and whistling.

item.title: Thriller fans enlist for 'Mission to Paris'
item.description: Summer 1938, Europe stands on the brink of war, and Paris is a city on the edge. Nazi spies, shadowy assassins, alluring double agents and a Hollywood movie star caught in the middle stalk the back alleys and bustling bistros of the French capital. This is the setting for Alan Furst's "Mission to Paris." The best-selling author has made a career of capturing the classic cloak-and-dagger days leading up to World War II, bringing the era to life like a literary version of "Casablanca."

item.description: Prosecutors may introduce an unaired portion of Jerry Sandusky's interview with NBC's Bob Costas as evidence.

item.title: Colo. firefighters face more wind, heat
item.description: Forecasters are expecting warmer than normal temperatures and gusty winds Tuesday in a northern Colorado area ravaged by a wildfire, not a good combination for the 1,700 people battling the blaze

item.title: Facebook to tie ads to your Web use
item.description: Facebook will soon be using your Web browsing to help decide which advertisements you see.

item.title: Rescuing child sex slaves in Minn.
item.description: Minnesota kicks off a new initiative to rescue child sex slaves. CNN's Deborah Feyerick reports.

item.title: Roger Clemens acquitted on all charges
item.description: Baseball's Roger Clemens was found not guilty Monday of lying to Congress during an investigation of steroid use among major league players. "I put a lot of hard work into that career," he told reporters, choking up on the steps of the federal courthouse in Washington.

item.title: Opinion: Going after Clemens stupid
item.description: Well, Roger Clemens has finally done it.

item.title: Police: Man chops off daughter's head
item.description: Police in the northern India state of Rajasthan say they were stunned when a man showed up at a police outpost holding a bloody human head in one hand and a sword in another.

item.title: Popular Pakistani singer shot dead
item.description: A popular female Pakistani singer who defied the Taliban's decree against singing and dancing was shot and killed in northwest Pakistan Monday night, police and hospital officials told CNN.

item.title: U.S. deserter surfaces 28 years later
item.description: 28 years after going AWOL, fugitive David Hemler re-appears. His family thought he was dead. CNN's Mary Snow reports.

item.title: USAF mum on mystery space plane
item.description: Filmed with infrared cameras, a highly secretive unmanned Air Force space plane lands after more than a year in orbit.

item.title: Tiny Darth Vader leaves hospital
item.description: Max Page, the 7-year-old who played a mini-Darth Vader in a Volkswagen commercial, Monday left a hospital in Los Angeles where he had undergone heart surgery.

item.title: Drunk driver finds arresting cop
item.description: Affiliate KETV reports on an emotional reunion between a former drunk driver and the officer who arrested him.

item.title: Michelle Obama does double dutch
item.description: First lady Michelle Obama shows off her "double dutch" jump rope skills.

item.title: Rare white (but muddy) rhino born
item.description: Take a look at this rare baby rhinoceros born in Israel.

item.title: Watch giant mushroom storm cloud
item.description: A storm chaser captures the beauty of severe weather in western Minnesota on video.

item.title: Dad's best advice
item.description: People in downtown Atlanta step up to CNN's "Open Mic" to share dad's best advice and say happy Father's Day.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Waiting for our son to wake up
item.description: A freak accident during a trip to the beach left Ryan Buchanan in a persistent vegetative state. His parents are caring for him at home -- hoping that one day they'll be able to communicate with him again.

item.title: River rafting tour passes nude beach
item.description: A new river rafting tour takes travelers past a secluded beach often used by nude sunbathers. KOVR reports.

item.title: Famous fathers and their famous kids
The Taliban's unlikeliest foe
item.description: The Taliban has tried to kill Fawzia Koofi numerous times, once riddling her car with bullets. But that doesn't deter the two-term Parliamentary member from running to be Afghanistan's next president. And when the pressure seems unbearable, she turns toward her inspiration, her young daughters.

item.title: Koofi: 'Afghanistan has come a long way'
item.description: Fawzia Koofi, Afghanistan's first female Parliament speaker, discusses her plan to run for president of the country.

item.title: 'Sandusky 8' tell of seduction and betrayal
item.description: Eight young men who said they were molested by Jerry Sandusky told unforgettable stories about a man who called himself "The Great Pretender."

item.title: Photos: Our favorite TV dads
Open Mic: Dad's best advice
item.description: People in downtown Atlanta step up to CNN's "Open Mic" to share dad's best advice and say happy Father's Day.

item.title: Opinion: When a son surpasses his father
item.description: My heart was pounding so hard, it felt as if it were trying to break free from my body.

item.title: The bittersweet side of Father's Day
item.description: Kimberly Brewer's most memorable Father's Day was the one when she realized how much she would miss him.

item.title: Get a Father's Day check up
item.description: I am extremely blessed.

item.title: New owners, new story
item.description: For the Dodgers, a year makes all the difference.

item.title: Sex abuse covered up in Jewish sect?
item.description: CNN's Gary Tuchman reports on accusations of abuse in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community.

item.title: Teen can't recall how spear got in his head
item.description: Doctors say a teen who had a 3-foot spear shot through his skull is recovering. WSVN reports.

item.title: Is 'psychic' tech scary?
item.description: The future will emerge at Internet meet Le Web, says Andrew Keen, and it will change our lives.

item.title: Golden Retriever rides in side-car
item.description: Jim Larson and his Golden Retriever ride around in a Russian motorcycle with a side-car.

item.title: 'Jungle Bird' explains U.S. Open stunt
item.description: The man behind the "Jungle Bird" call during the U.S. Open ceremony sits down with Jeanne Moos to explain why he did it.

item.title: Musician embraces whistling on stage
item.description: Multi-instrumentalist Andrew Bird discusses his musical approach and the similarities between the violin and whistling.

item.title: Thriller fans enlist for 'Mission to Paris'
item.description: Summer 1938, Europe stands on the brink of war, and Paris is a city on the edge. Nazi spies, shadowy assassins, alluring double agents and a Hollywood movie star caught in the middle stalk the back alleys and bustling bistros of the French capital. This is the setting for Alan Furst's "Mission to Paris." The best-selling author has made a career of capturing the classic cloak-and-dagger days leading up to World War II, bringing the era to life like a literary version of "Casablanca."
